item.title: Wealth Wednesday #11 Down with engagement groups!
item.content:encoded:
Hello!

Hope you are having a great Wednesday. A little bit earlier than usual, but here is a summary of my latest experiences with engagement groups.

Who does this apply to?
It is required to have a few thousand followers already, I would say at least 5000 REAL FOLLOWERS. Bots won't do you any good. You also need researched and properly working hashtags.

What is it about?
Stop using engagement groups! With IG's lates updates, they plan on looking at accounts who have been part of any engagement groups, had likes or engagement from outside of Instagram (Telegram), or used any automation. As the elections are coming up these are probably aimed toward anything that has to do with politics. 
But next to protecting your account it also helps you to viral more often. 
I stopped using engagement groups on all my account, and since I had good hashtags it didn't matter as I got 10's of thousands of reach anyway from them, but my like count from an average of 500 went to 1K, and sometimes over the 3K territory. Having pages with 5 and 9K followers this engagement WITHOUT groups is really crazy!

It's all about being patient!
I didn't get the 150 likes in the first 10 minutes from the groups as I usually do, but waiting over 24hours had its results. This let the post pop up in my followers feed and collect the initial likes from there, and from there it's just the snowball effect.

Give this a try for a few days and see if you can get the same or better results! I am rooting for you!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #10 Build a community!
item.content:encoded:
Happy Wealth Wednesday Everyone!


It's been a while, but while missing posts I have also been testing some new strategies, and I one of them seem to be really working, so read along to learn more.


To us "experts" or people who take Instagram as a serious business it might be a surprise, but sticking to it's roots and handling it as a social platform actually still gets you loyal followers.


There are more than just hashtag research, spamming robots, and buying fake followers. If you can build your own community, the results might be slower, but in the long term you can only win.


Blablalbla..So what to actually do?


To start this you SHOULD have atleast 2000-3000 followers.
It is about making your followers engage with your page. You have to build a community, but no one works for free, neither do your followers. You have to reward them for helping you grow, and with a solid following a shoutout is a good deal.


I started off testing by pinning the best comments. My caption was: "Caption this,best 3 comments get pinned!"
And people actually wrote more engaging and well thought out comments, so they could get pinned and more people can see their profiles. (Yes people mostly care about themselves, but it is fine, we make a deal!)


So after this short test I went ahead and created my own hashtag that had 0 posts before, and started to promote it in my bio,story and captions: "Use #myhashtag and tag @us in your posts to be featured!"


So why does this work?
As I have already mentioned, people like publicity and exes on their profiles, so a free shoutout in exchange to adding an extra hashtag and tag is really simple. This is why you need atleast 2000 followers, to make your story reshares more valuable. 
These days I go ahead and check my hashtag and posts I am tagged in, and share the best ones to my stories, and even post a few of them.


How do you get more followers by this?
By being tagged in photos, everyone who sees that picture is likely to come by your profile, maybe even click through and check out your page. If you have a well built profile, that's a new follower! Imagine being tagged in only 5 posts a day, but each post reaches atleast 200 people. That's 1000 new potential profile visits! Of course, in reality the conversion rate is really low, but this way lets you build a solid connection with your fanbase, and gets you new, interested followers!


Also eventually your own hashtag will be also trending, that would work the same way as I just described the tags.
So please! Use this social media platform as it was meant to be used!
Let's build a strong community and grow further!
Have an amazing rest of your day!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #9 Useful tools for Instagram management
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone!
Hope you had a great day! Today I just quickly want to share some useful tools for your Instagram account.

1. Phlanx
Extremely useful tool to quickly and freely check your Engagement rate. (it was free, now it offers a free 1 month trial) They are also updating their features, recently they added Influencer audits, which can be useful when choosing the right person to collaborate with.

2. Canva
This was one of my first apps to try, and still is one of my favorite. It let's you create free design for basically every social media platform, with premade themes.

3. Editing apps
I don't want to mention every editing app separately, so the rest goes here. Lightroom and Photoshop are widely used, because they let you live your creativity, while Canva is simpler.

4. Posting, scheduling tools.
The are apps like Buffer and Hootsuite, but I don't think you need to pay for this feature. You can simply use the built in publishing tools, one from the Publishing Tools from your page's Facebook page, if you have one connected.
If you don't, worry not: The Instagram app itself has you covered. You can just create a post, write the caption, use the location tags, and tag people as you normally would, but instead of posting you tap onto the top-left "back" arrow and save the post as draft.
To save more time, you can also add your hashtags into your caption, so you don't have to go in and first comment them.
BE CAREFUL:
Updates, and redownloading the app deletes your drafts, and sometimes it just gets buggy for no reason, so I wouldn't schedule a week's worth of content here.

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #8 Telegram engagement groups
item.content:encoded:
Hello Everyone! 
What a beautiful day, Wealth Wednesday #8 is here!
Even though it's more like #7.5.

This is part 2 of the engagement group post, and this time we got into more details about Telegram groups.
I will link the previous post so you can read what engagement groups are and if they worth using.
Click here to read!

One big difference is, while IG groups can only have 32 members, Telegram groups can have up to thousands of members! This is definitely a good thing, as more active members means faster engagement on your posts.

How to get in these groups?
First, you have to download the Telegram app, and register simply in one minute. Then, you hit the search bar and type " *your niche* dx"
This should bring up a few groups. DX means how many times you have to engage before you can drop your link. You will get the same amount of likes back. There are likes only, like+comment groups, niche specific ones and even with minimum follower requirements.
You can literally type Telegram engagement groups into google and you will have plenty of sources to choose from.
I recommend starting out with the "Boostgram" family.

Now, that you are in these groups you usually have to write /list to get the list of the posts you need to engage with. In comment groups it's usually comments that contain atleast 4 words, and are genuine, and related to the photo.
Some groups even have you following their admins.
After you are done engaging on all your links, you go back to the group and write:
DX *number you had to engage with* **yourlink**
Make sure to format your link correctly, you have to remove everything until the question mark like this:
https://www.instagram.com/p/CDPCnyyghU6/?igshid=1udkei3t8wisn
------------>
https://www.instagram.com/p/CDPCnyyghU6/

Personally, I think Telegram group are better for the following reasons:
1. It's much more faster, you get the engagement a lot sooner compared to an Intagram POD.
2. This should have been number one! The bot makes sure for every engagement you get one back! We all know that in IG groups some people just drop their links, but never engage. Even if they do, it's so generic or just an emoji. This way with Telegram, you don't feel like you are wasting your time, it's more like an investment.
3. There are more options, it's faster to join them, you can literally find the perfect niche group for your page with the desired engagement numbers you need.
4. You don't risk an account ban. We know that Instagram is monitoring these groups, of course they are avare of these "grey methods". That is why most groups restrict the words "new post", "like,comment,save", and post links.

Basically these are the reasons to use Telegram, but I think it is enough to switch to them from IG groups. If you think I forgot something, or have questions, or a different perspective make sure to comment and give your feedback!

Have a great day!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #7 Instagram engagement groups
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! Hope you had a great weekend! A bit of a later post this week, I was working so much that I slipped a bit... Anyway, at least there is another ebook coming really soon!

Last week we talked about engagement rates and fake profiles, so today it's a great opportunity to learn about boosting your engagement rate, and with that boosting your credibility and reach.

Obviously, the first step is to create and post engaging content. On Instagram, the "content is king" rule is still true! Post great, well-written captions with questions, controversial topics, or call-to-actions (for example go to the link in bio!)

But today I wanted to specifically talk about engagement groups. You might have heard of them before, they are even called as engagement PODS, DM groups, but it's all the same.
There are 2 big types of engagement groups: on Instagram and on Telegram. Both have their pros and cons.

Let's start with Instagram DM groups this week, and next week we are going to discuss Telegram since it's quite a topic.

Why should you use engagement groups in the first place? Or maybe you should avoid them?

As I already said they can help you boost your engagement rates by having more likes and comments on your posts.
In theory, by getting other accounts to quickly engage with your content, the Instagram algorithm will be tricked into thinking your post is high quality.
These likes don't come from bots, and if you are using the right groups they actually come from the perfect people! On Instagram, there can be 32 people in a DM group, usually from the same niche and with the same following, which counts as really good engagement for the algorithm.

What are the downsides?
This is really, REALLY time-consuming! You can easily spend hours PER ACCOUNT doing these groups a day. You can't just copy and paste the same comment every time without getting banned.

Only 32 members. They need to be really active to engage with your posts as soon as you drop it. (Telegram groups can have thousands of people)

Now that you know the pros and cons, you can make the decision if you want to use them. If yes, how do you get in one?
Just like in real life and business, having the right connections and good networking skills can help you. If you have a great page and a good following at least around 700-1000 followers you can be invited to one of them, but if it doesn't happen don't worry.
There is a great trick to actually get yourself into a DM group with bigger accounts than yours! Just simply reach out to people in your niche and ask them if they are interested in supporting each other and growing together. Don't give up after the first 10 "no"!

That's a few words about IG DM groups... If you made it this far thanks for reading, make sure to leave your feedback! Thank you!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #6 How to recognize a real profile?
item.content:encoded:
How to recognize a real Instagram account?

Everyone is an expert today on social media, and looking at their profile full of rented cars and 10K followers can be really convincing. But how do you know if their following is real and engaging?

I think you have seen it many times. Everyone can rent a nice apartment for a day to film hours of content, and bring their rented cars there as well. Also the 10.000 follower mark is really important, since this is the point where the number is no longer written out, but has the "K" letter. 10K baby!

Also at 10K you can be verified and get the blue badge, and add the swipe up feature to your stories which is a really amazing tool! But let's talk about that later when we learn more about growing your IG and getting more engagement.

1. Engagement rate
What is Engagement Rate(ER)?
It is calculated as total engagement (likes and comments) divided by total followers, multiplied by 100.
There are percentages for average engagement rates, for more see the pictures. However anything over 10% is considered really good.
There are websites to check it to save the hustle, for example I use phlanx.com.

2. Follower demographics
Yes, not the follower count, but the demographics. Who is likely to make more money? Someone with 11k followers from third-world countries, or an account who has 2400 loyal, engaging followers who watch stories, and message them.
I would put my money on the second option.
There are free tools to check if an account has fake followers, but you can do it too. Just check if their followers look real, fake accounts usually: have very few posts, no stories/profile picture, generic/no bio, follow thousand of people,have meaningless name.

What is the problem?
The main problem today on Intagram is if someone wants to promote their services/product they will usually pay (unrealistically) more for someone with the bigger follower count. I wish a lot of people would read through this point and could save a few $! Heck maybe hundreds of dollars..
I can register an account, post 15 pictures and buy 15k fake followers and be a guru by the end of the night, but I dont want to scam anyone.

If you are looking for someone to product your services or brand, make sure you analyze their profile! Check engagement rates, their followers, how many people they are following, look at the comments and whether she/he is responding to them. Please dont pay for zero result and waste your money!

Hope I could help you! Have a beautiful rest of your day!.

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #5 Profile visits to followers
item.content:encoded:
Hi there! Hope you had a great day today!

Let's talk about profile visits, and most importantly, how to convert your profile visits into followers on Instagram.

You might have also faced the problem where your posts get good engagement, plenty of profile visits but there are no new followers coming in. Recently I have been testing a few good strategies, and highlights seemed to help me.

Here is just a short intro to why it works. Instagram makes money (this is just one of the many ways) by showing ads to it's users. The more time you spend on Instagram, the more ads it can show to you. So if you make peope spend time on your profile, Instagram will value you more, and place you better in the news feed.
But let's say that isn't true and we nothing about the algorythm. We like to spend time on engaging content, watch videos, so if one account constatly shows us exactly that, we will remember then, and even look for their content every day.

So what to do exactly?
The greater example is my travel account. (@traveldreamachieve) There are many ways to make people engage with your content, I found the best to be stories.
Check my highlights. Same colors, same theme, so it is easy to understand and navigate on my page (not like an IG page can get any complicated)

One method which is more travel specific is "Guess where!" where obviously you see a photo and have to guess through "Quiz" where that photo was taken.
With a little twist it can be used with any niche, for example "Guess the brand!" or "Guess the flavor!" Get creative!

The second one is the "Choose one" story, where you simply edit two pictures into a story (use Photoshop, or for beginners,Canva) and use the "Poll" feature to let people vote.

Along these you can share crazy, controversial with a slider, that also gets people to engage.

These are just a few trick that I have used recently to boost the profile visit to follower ratio on my account. Still Content is King, engaging captions and great photo quality is required.

Try these and let me know how it goes!
See you soon again!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #4 Action Block
item.content:encoded:
Hello Everyone! Here is another (I hope) helpful post, now about Action Block.
If you don't know what action block is, it is when Instagram blocks you from commenting, liking, and writing captions. You can still post a picture without a caption, share stories, and use the DMs.
It happens because you exceed the action limits on Instagram. That is why aggressive follow for follow, automation, spam liking and mass-unfollowing doesn't really work. Also, be careful with liking comments, that's also a sensitive point.
There are two types of action block, one with an expiry date, and one without, it can even last up to two weeks.

What are the limits?
It depends on your account age, engagement rates, and follower count. The younger your account is, the less action you can do. I have just basic numbers that protected me from getting banned, which is MAX:
20 follow/unfollow every 2hours
1000 likes daily
30 comments and comment likes every 1 hour
3 post a day (doesn't get you banned but no point in posting more)

How to lift the action block?
If you still get banned there are a few ways you can try to get rid of it. Obviously, if it has an expiry date you can't help that, but otherwise, try these tips:

1. Clear the Instagram app cache
Usually, you can do it by going to you phone's settings, Apps, select Instagram and there should be this option.

2. Relog
Too obvious to be true, but it worked for me. Just log out of your account and then log in and wait a bit.

3. Re-install the Instagram app
It basically step 1 and 2 combined-

4. Change your bio, stay active
Instagram might banned you because you looked too spammy, so changing up you bio and profile picture might be a good way to show that you are an active user. Also, keep sharing stories and talking to your audience, again, showing that you are a real, engaging Instagram user, not a spammer bot.

5. Report the problem to Instagram
If you really feel like you didn't do anything and ended up being action blocked, report the problem to Instagram through the app settings. When the “action blocked” error pops up, it usually has two options: Tell us and Ignore. To request a manual review by Instagram, tap the Tell us button. But some types of error pop-ups have no other option but OK. In this case, do the following: press Settings, then Help, then Report a Problem. (Use this even if you used some services)

6. Connect your Instagram account to a Facebook page
This action again shows Instagram that you are not a bot.

7. Wait
Sometimes none of these tips work, then you can't do anything but wait up to 2 weeks. Try to keep you audience engaged through stories and DMs.

It can really feel devastating not being able to post for 2 weeks, but try to stay patient and not do actions that just pop up the Block message, as it won't help you. Some of these tips might help you, but be careful, as too many action blocks can get your account banned. When you get back your account, make sure you slowly ramp things up, not risking another block.

I hope this can help you! If you have any questions let us know, feel free to contact us! If you are still afraid of getting banned, try to find an Instagram Agency that can safely grow your account, just like we do!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #3 First 100 followers
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! I hope you all had a successful Wealth Wednesday. Today I am here to help you build your foundations, let's say your first 100, or a few hundred followers.

1. Follow for follow
There are many controversy around this, but from my experience, this is the best way to start growing your page and do this up until the 1000-2000 follower mark. After that, you will have just enough reach from you Home page, which will put your posts to the explore page and let them rank on hashtags as well.

Who to follow?
This is a good question! Many people would just follow big accounts with millions of followers, as you will show up in their followers list and will be followed by the people who also do follow for follow. Obviously, this won't be your perfect audience.
So what you should do is to find your best followers, is first, find other pages in your niche, ideally around the 100K-500K follower mark, as they won't have many bot and inactive accounts. This already gives you a smaller group of people who are somewhat interested in your niche.
To find more valuable people, you will have to go and open the posts of the page and follow the likers and commenters, preferably with stories. This definitely shows that they are active and engaging users, who are really interested in your niche.
There is one other, even better way to find the engaging users, which is by checking the posts' average like counts and find the posts that have fewer likes. What does it mean? They aren't coming from the explore page, rather, from their home page, and they are so loyal that even with the worse-performing posts they will engage. That is a golden follower right there!

When a person goes to your page, your message has to be clear as to why that person should follow you. That's where we go back to the #1 Wealth Wednesday post, and see how to set up our bio, and how many posts you should have. Or if you are too lazy to do that, maybe find an agency to do all this dirty work for you! We are here!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #2 Hashtags
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! It is Wealth Wednesday!
Today we are talking about hashtags.
I see many people have problems with them, or just throw a few here and there, and wonder why they have no results. There is a few things you can do to perfect them, if interested, continue reading!

1. Do your research!
You have seen this many times without anyone actually telling you what to do.
You have to be active, and find accounts in your niche with the same size as yours. It is obviously important that they should be performing well, growing (organically!) without fake followers. If thats happening, they are doing something right!
Why do they have to be the same size(followers) as you?
The same hashtags wont work for a profile with 1M followers and 150 followers.
If someone is growing in your niche go and copy their hashtags(easier on a pc) and test them in your posts!

2. Test, test, test!
This is an important step in marketing whether talking about ads, hashtags or content. Having a copied hashtag list isnt enough, you have to tweak it and find the best performing ones!
For me it was almost 100 posts to test, but now I have 3 groups that will surely explode me to the explore page.

3.Have multiple hashtag groups
I have atleast 3-5 general hashtags in my niche, with the size of 20-25 and the rest is related to the current post. Instagram gets tired of you use the same hashtags over and over, and your posts will eventually lose reach.

4.How many hashtags to use?
You can use up to 30 hashtags each post,and I recommend to reach the limit, or atleast around 25. You should have 3 groups generally:
10 hashtags around 500k-1M size, general niche hashtags.
Then 10 other hashtags again in your niche, a little more specific with the size under 500k.
And the rest should be related to the current post around the size of 100k. This will get you rank on the smaller hashtags, and start a snowball towards the big ones.

5.Best research strategy
Go and count the average likes on your posts, and then you can find the best performing hashtags for your page. If you usually have 100likes, you should look for small hashtags (around 100k) and check the top nine posts and average their like counts. If its similar to your page's then that hashtag is likely to work for you.

I hope these tips can help you up your hashtag game! Ask in the comments or shoot a message if you need some help!

item.title: Wealth Wednesday #1 Basics
item.content:encoded:
Wealth Wednesday!

Hello everyone! Let's begin!
What is this all about? I want to help YOU grow your IG page, and growing your business..we all know why Instagram is a good place but we will talk about that another time.
Let's start with the basics.

1. Have a clear message!
It’s the most important. When someone goes to your profile there should be a reason why anyone should follow you. You need to provide value! Okay, you heard these a million times..What does it actually mean?
First, have your Profile Photo about your niche..Or a selfie. Have a clear bio, please don't write just two lines of nonsense. Have all your photos in 1x1 ratio, the IG ratio that is preferred to the best viewing experience. And keep you highlights related to your business, probably no one will care for a "My 18xx birthday lol"
How to provide value? For example, in my case, it's "teaching". Sharing information that is related to my business, but don't worry, you don't have to be a teacher. Providing value can be being funny, making people laugh, or if you are a model then just having the really perfect images and shining your beauty. It will give people reason to check out your feed on a daily.

2. Be consistent!
Did I just say daily? Yes... To get the best results you need to post every day, for more chance to blow up. I don't really prefer posting 2 times a day, as I think it messes with the first post's reach. You can post multiple times when starting out tho, so when people check you out they actually see at least 9 posts.
Success takes time blabla... But it really does, just like growing your page. My first page took like 3 months to reach 1000 followers, but from there it wasn't hard to have 100 follows a day. It is called the snowball effect. The bigger you get the harder you roll.

3. Do your research!
Research your competition, the viral/good performing content in your niche, the hashtags. It is not stealing, but most of the huge pages are huge for a reason. They already know what is working. Check their Call To Actions! It really does help. Since I tell my post's viewers to follow me, I have been getting a lot more follows. Another trick is to put the CTA to the first two lines of your caption, so they don't even have to click more, your profile will be the first thing they saw. It not too likely that a random person will read until the end of your caption, you need to grab their attention in the first second.

4. Test, Test, Test!
Be patient. For me, it took at least around 80 posts to have a few "winning hashtags" Now when I want to make sure my post gets to the explore page, I just copy them right in. I recommend using around 25 hashtags every post and changing them each post to find ones that really perform.
First, your hashtags will not get any reach. You can boost that, by engaging in your niche the minutes before- and after posting, and like and the comment in the hashtags that are in your post! Especially the bigger ones. For example, you might be posting a nice travel pic, and I recommend to use a smaller hashtag group when starting out, around 100K max. BUT if you put #travel in there with millions of posts, and engage right after, that means the posts you are engaging on have just been posted, so the owner will see the notification popping up, and is likely to check your page out! So make sure it looks good... Read again my first point.
